website_summaries.verdict: A recumbent tricycle for a smooth, comfortable ride.
pros: The recumbent design can be a more comfortable setup than traditional tricycles
The extra low-to-the-ground design makes it difficult to tip over
Caliper brakes are easy to use, and steering feels natural
cons: Though it's lightweight, this bike can be difficult to transport

website_summaries.verdict: Many people seek out a recumbent trike like this model for riders with balance issues, as well as older riders who want to use it for physical rehab or exercise.
pros: Recumbent design takes pressure off the back, making it good for therapy
Single gear works on most flat, firm terrains
Frame extends for older children and larger adults
Fits riders up to six foot three and 250 pounds
cons: Pedals can become loose over time
Rear wheels cannot be adjusted for toe-in or toe-out configurations

customer_reviews.title: The perfect transportation for us octagenarians
customer_reviews.text: Superior product with excellent engineering. When I looked at some of the criticisms I was reluctant to buy. I made all the mistakes published in the reviews. Then I went back and REALLY read the instructions. All problems corrected rides perfectly. I additional tip. Be sure to use loctite on EVERY threaded part you assemble. Solves all problems. When assembling fenders, loctite the shaft and HOLD the fender in alignment while tightening the nut.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Mobo bike
customer_reviews.text: I received my bike 12-5-17 and I liked it. But now I'm not sure. The peddles keep falling off. It's hardly been ridden since I got it because we've had alot of rain. It's very frustrating . My husband added some lock nuts on the peddles It seems to be working now. Hopefully he has fixed the problem. I do like riding it when it stays together. Now I've put less than forty miles on the bike and the back tires are shot! I've had my two wheel bike for years and still have never changed the tires. This bike just seems to be of poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: SERIOUS DESIGN FLAW. NON ADJUSTABLE DRAG LINK BETWEEN TIE ...
customer_reviews.text: SERIOUS DESIGN FLAW . NON ADJUSTABLE DRAG LINK BETWEEN TIE RODS.NO WHEEL ALIGNMENT POSSIBLE..TIRES WILL FAIL.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: What a gift for kids/adults with balance issues
customer_reviews.text: Our son has muscle strength issues on one side of his body. Regular bike without training wheels was not really an option and at his age, training wheels and kids =not so nice comments. This trike is such a relief and such a gift! He loves it, it’s so easy to assemble and is perfect for cruising around. Thank you Mobo!
customer_reviews.author: Buttons

customer_reviews.title: Great workout and I feel safe
customer_reviews.text: I do feel like I have hotwheels, only they are for an adult. I had a bad fall from my bike (there are no good ones) and said this is it....You really have to work hard on this trike. It fits into a subaru outback and you can go places. It was not too hard to put together (Youtube), it did take us some time... I would recommend it to anyone who suffers from balance problems or other impediments that make riding a regular bike unsafe. I certainly enjoy it!
customer_reviews.author: CHS Realtor

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, too small even though its suppose to fit an average adult, hard to use, sorry I got it, want to return it, but putting the darn thing in a box and shipping back is such a mess. Not sure what I'll do yet. Go to a bike store and buy a bike on site. Mail order is not the way to go for bike shopping. I just went to a Schwinn dealer, got a very nice recumbent for about the same $$, just a little more, but what a better bike! Save your $$ and your time.
customer_reviews.author: MINIMOM

customer_reviews.title: *Buyer Beware*
customer_reviews.text: *buyer beware* Really nice bike but lame customer service. There's only a 30 day warranty on a $300 bike. I lost 6 screws for the seats on two bikes. They just kept falling off with vibration. Customer service gave me the run around and now will charge me money to replace the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My child who is on the Autism spectrum couldn't get ...
customer_reviews.text: My child who is on the Autism spectrum couldn't get the hang of riding a two-wheeled bike. That is common for kids on the spectrum. Got this for his birthday and he loves it. So do all the neighborhood kids. That is the only Con....all the kids want to ride it. I can even ride it and I am 5'11" and 175lbs. The frame extends so when your child grows the bike grows with them. I needs gears however, as it will only go as fast as your legs will go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unprofessional and Negligent
customer_reviews.text: What heck is this crap. I just got it and you can tell they put an additional box around the original box, it was so beat up. The bike was disassembled and haphazardly crammed in, nuts and bolts were supposed to be secured were strewn about, it was a cluster @&!:$. Even the pedals were broken, no joke I don’t think I’ll be able to assemble it. I will try, but there’s no packing list. Who knows what missing. I’m so angry this better be salvageable.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Very limited
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be a perfect replacement bike for my old knees so that I could ride with the kids. However, it steers like a zero turn lawnmower and it drifts sideways uncontrollably. All of that I could deal with but come to find out you are not supposed to ride on any road. Now take into consideration that it only has one speed and very UN-aggressive tires, as well as you would need a truck bed to transport somewhere and the options of where you can ride this are now extremely limited.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.text: Useless POS. Have had to replace the pedal shafts and all 3 tires with less than 75 miles on the trike. I'm afraid to go too far because I've had to drag it back 3 times. Also came dinged up and scratched.
customer_reviews.author: lisamarie pocza

customer_reviews.title: Special Needs Can Use This Bike, Depending On Severity Of Disability
customer_reviews.text: I Bought This Bike for my Special Needs Granddaughter, Since We Couldn’t Afford A Regular Handicap Adaptable Bike Which Are THOUSANDS Of Dollars Depending On Needs And Medicaid & Insurances Don’t Come Through With Any Funding, We Waited 8 Years For Some Help And NOTHING! This Was Her First Time Riding It And She Picked Up Fast With the Peddling& Steering, Plus It Seems To Work Well In GRASS With The Durable Tires! The Price For The Blue Was Lower Than Red Or Black When We Purchased It For Her, So For Under $400 It Was A Good Deal!
customer_reviews.author: YA YA Granny

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in all wasy
customer_reviews.text: The mobo triton is described and advertised perfectly There were many comments that encourage It works perfectly for our 96 year old father He loves it and he gets wonderful exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Susan Doren

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble if you follow the directions. Easy to pedal up hills. It is not meant to be a racing bike. My large dog needs more exercise than just a walk. This bike is perfect for his walks. I can keep my balance when he gets distracted and he can trot beside me. I can either pedal or let him pull me. Love this!!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY IT!!
customer_reviews.text: After spending almost an hour putting together this trike i noticed that the screws where the seat needs to be screwed are welded in the wrong side!!!!! what a POS , I immediately call MOBO customer service to see if they could do something and of course they didn't give a crap. Now I'm down $400 and need to wait for UPS to pick it up for a refund . What a nightmare !!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: eliud

customer_reviews.title: Best product on Earth!
customer_reviews.text: What did I like? A Army Infantry Vet with perminint terrible knee pain! This is the only Bike I can comfortably ride! It's my physical therapy that's not painful & mental health it cleans my mind cardio wise. I LOVE this product in every way shape and form. Its adjustable so my kids can ride it. Its exotic & not embarrased to ride it. THANK YOU Mobo. This will forever and always be something I enjoy & hope other people want to enjoy this successful comforting ride as much as I do. Until then I am your biggest fan. Excuse me while I have to go ride my Mobo.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Wargo

customer_reviews.title: For flat land only!
customer_reviews.text: Sorely disappointed with this product. Here in east TN there are few level places to ride which makes this "cruiser" almost unusable. With no weight over the front wheel traction is at a premium. Nearly one out of every two rotations spin rather than produce forward motion. After receiving the trike I find they don't want you to ride it on the road. Huge turning radius and inability to backup are also big issues.
customer_reviews.author: G Gould Smith

customer_reviews.title: Well built product!
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews before purchasing, this is such a great product. Quick assembly and such a smooth ride. Exactly what I wanted! I saw this type bike featured on a newscast regarding stroke victims and their need for exercise. I have MS, and after a few modifications to the left pedal, I am now mobile again! Safety was one of my first concerns, it’s low to the ground, the brake system is great, and the flag is very visible. I’m a very happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but short cuts were made in design
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 13 yr old with muscle disease. She loves it. It does turn wide. Corners were cut making the bike to keep the cost down. The fake leather on the seat is stapled on the back without a piece to cover and hide the staples. Makes me think the material will tear off staples eventually. The screws holding the seat in place are too short and one fell out 2 min into the first ride down our driveway. Only had the bike for two weeks but so far so good otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Aussie approved!
customer_reviews.text: I have an Australian Shepard and walking is not enough for her, even after playing several times a day. She loves to run and I can't run because my knees can't handle the impact. I have her leash situated just right on the left steering handle. This lil trike is a lifesaver and so FUN!!! We live on a lake and we like to ride around it. I will be ordering another one for my husband now so we can load them up in our truck and take them on more adventures!
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Great way to exercise
customer_reviews.text: I do really like the ride, it's well made, nice bright colors.The low profile and light weight allow me to put the bike in my SUV. The flag was not tall enough to be seen so I replaced it. I am 70 y/o so it is tricky to get out off. There's a hand break that works great, I would like a brake for when not in use, sometimes it rolls some. It's an attention getter too people have questions about it, even taking the website.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Woodford

customer_reviews.title: Fun and great exercise and easy to ride!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 71 year old male 155 lbs got it to improve upon my health is the reason I purchased the trike. After riding for a couple of hours couldn’t be more pleased! Yes, it doesn’t have gears but It handles the slopes and hills on the sidewalks in the city just find! I rode it around the park and was told “l saw you coming” by a half a dozen individuals (Orange Color). The assemble was very easy, took me less than a hour!
customer_reviews.author: David Lee Brauer

customer_reviews.title: Love my Mobo!!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. I did it by myself. I ride along the bike path at the beach and LOVE my Mobo!!! Only thing is that I should have upgraded and purchase the one that has different gears. That was my fault. But at least I know what to do for the next time I need a new one. I didn't want to spend all that money unless I knew that I was going to ride it. And I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Beth A. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Meet all expectations
customer_reviews.text: Have had the bike several weeks now and love it.it is very easy to ride.would like to also say customer service is great.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the whole family!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 9yo autistic son. He enjoys it very much and had no problem figuring it out. The shortest position allows our 4’ 6yo to ride it and at the longest length my 5’11” husband can also ride it. We all have want to replace our bicycles. It was easy to assemble with clear instructions and not many parts. So happy our autistic son can enjoy riding now too!!!
customer_reviews.author: MoCo1007

customer_reviews.title: Missing or wrong screws
customer_reviews.text: Some of the screws were missing or did not fit. I have had to go to a a local hardware store to get the correct screws again. Company will not replace two screws without having an invoice to send them. I have spent more time with telephone calls than it is worth. I still need two screws for it. I am very dissatisfied with the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Monte Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Both bikes had welds that came apart within a month or two
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these bikes, theybareived on time and were great for the first month. One of the bikes came apart at the front weld on the fork and I was able to return it. Well, a week or two after the return window closed the second bike came apart in the same exact spot. Unfortunately it looks like both bikes had weak welds on the front fork and now I can not return the second one so I am out several hundred dollars. Other then that they were really fun to ride.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Birthday present
customer_reviews.text: Daughter has balance problems and couldn’t get the whole normal bike thing. She loves this!! Easy to read instructions, easy to ride. My only two complaints from an adult because I rode it too were: no gears and no reverse. Extra gears would be nice when u have an incline, and reverse that would be icing on the cake.
customer_reviews.author: nic

customer_reviews.title: Broke in les than 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our son with CP. He loved the bike. It is the First bike that he has ever ridden. He LOVED the independence that it provided. Unfortunately, he has had the bike for less than 2 months and it broke. The warranty that comes with the bike is for 1 month. I am hoping that the manufacturer does the right thing and replaces his bike
customer_reviews.author: K. Hays

customer_reviews.title: ... husband purchased this for me and I am in love with it
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this for me and I am in love with it. Its comfortable, easy to use, and is fun. A great change from riding a typical bike. The only downside is riding it up and down out of the garage. It is hard to ride this bike uphill, and in my opinion is best on sidewalks I take it to the park and ride it in my neighborhood. I have received many praises for this bike and truly enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for the disabled.
customer_reviews.text: Great bike. Ran into a problem when assembling, but the company stood by their product and helped resolve the issue in a timely matter. This was a gift for our handicapped son on Christmas & you have never seen a kid smile so much. Bike is easy to ride and very sturdy. We are very happy with this bike!!
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike! Be aware it is only for flat surfaces like they say in other reviews as you need to peddle constantly or it stops. It works well with my health issues and I am enjoying it as often as I can. Stearing and breaking are very easy . If you need help standing this bike is very close to the ground, keep that in mind. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: WildThunder71

customer_reviews.title: Finally! An Adult "Big Wheel"!!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together: most bolts are already in place, all necessary tools included, YouTube Video walks you step by step! Like your child's Big Wheel you do not have gear to gear ratio advantage.....so while it is effortless to pedal......it is not fast! But it does turn heads and smiles!! Perfect for older folks, too! ♫♪♫
customer_reviews.author: Peter Lakatos

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing in almost every way.
customer_reviews.text: For NON-special needs adults, there is nothing about this product that I would recommend. Except it's pretty and the manufacturers see to be nice, well meaning people. Descriptions and videos are misleading. It's almost a toy. The one gear is terrible for flat surfaces where in fact the trike is supposed to be great. Heels of my size 10 1/2 - 11 shoes hit the pavement. The seat and seat back are cheap and unfomfortable. If you want a recumbent trike, get a real one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent Bike
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bike for my son who is 11 and has Cerebral Palsy. He loves the bike and it works well with him being right side hemiplegic. The down side is there are no gears, so going up hill is struggle. Figuring out the steering was also a little bit of a challenge. During assembly some of the bolts didn’t line up and I had to have my dad help me. Overall, he’s happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for an adult and easy to ride.
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed this bike! It is all that it claims. It is perfect for my neighborhood that is flat. It would not be useful in a hilly area. Be sure to align the wheels properly or the tires my wear out unevenly. You can request specific alignment instructions from the customer service phone number.

customer_reviews.title: not for gravel of any kind,
customer_reviews.text: Not really for adults however does work. uneven surfaces, gravel of any kind and up hill very poor. I would have wished for more transparency regarding use at an adult prospective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.author: JRV

customer_reviews.title: Fun bike!
customer_reviews.text: This bike is super fun and great for someone like me with back issues. It's a bit slower than I like, but I kinda expected that. Only gave 4 stars because the bike has some cosmetic damage, but since its already together I dont feel like exchanging it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Broken steering
customer_reviews.text: I went through way too much trouble to get this thing ready for a test drive only for the steering to break on the first ride. Almost got ran over in the spot where it broke off. Can't even fix it since the screw and washer were lost along the route. Fun to build, but the steering mechanism needs an update so this doesn't happen so easily.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Calderon

customer_reviews.title: Great trike - looks awesome
customer_reviews.text: We love this bike. The only downside to this bike is it takes a little coordination to use it. The back tires move with the movement of the handlebars. That can be confusing at first, but easily figure out-able.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi J.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike for exercise. It doesn't go fast which helps you exercise those muscles all the time, but when you go down hill you can get that speed and rest your legs a bit. I read a review about this bike not being able to go up the hill, I disagree. I've been going up the hills, asphalt road, and this bike works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: avva

customer_reviews.title: Work out bike! Be careful, practice the turning of the Handlebars.
customer_reviews.text: What I like about it, it will give you a hell of a work out. It is fun to ride and not that hard to put together. My dis likes are that it is not so fast. Unless your come down a hill!! It could be dangerous!! I fell on it the first day and hurt my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Trivia Dieli

customer_reviews.title: Excited! Next is scheduling.
customer_reviews.text: After the assembly was done at the bike shop, I was excited to ride it for a functioning test. I pedaled straight forward, curve right, curve left, and a fun figure 8 in the safety of the parking lot compared to the street. Now, I just need to make a schedule of how often that I should ride it, maybe two to three times in miles of minimum 3 miles and probably less than 5 miles and maybe at least a month of rest at least once a year.
customer_reviews.author: YEE-LING ELAINE CHAU

customer_reviews.title: This is the Koolest Bike I have ever had, ...

customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: This mobo triton is great i ride it every day i could not ride ...
customer_reviews.text: This mobo triton is great i ride it every day i could not ride a two wheel bike because of my balance ,I am 74 and this mobo with three wheels is fantastic,Also the shipping was great got it the day they said i would and it took me about 30 min.to put it togather i was riding less then and hour fromm the time i got it

customer_reviews.text: It is fairly easy to ride, however the seat is too low for me. Arthritis and sciatica limit ability to get up from the seat. Added a bit of padding which has helped, but had to avoid making the height too great, thereby raising the center of gravity to the point of instability. But I am resourceful. I enjoy the trike very much . Now, I must rebuild my physical strength to tackle hills. BTW, I am 72 years old.

customer_reviews.text: This Is a nice trike but the seat Is to close to the ground for me an my wife, I'm 76 an my wife Is 80 so its hard for us to get back up an off the bike
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Rinehart

customer_reviews.title: great cycle. I have 2 autistic teens who cannot ...
customer_reviews.text: great cycle. I have 2 autistic teens who cannot balance well. This is PERFECT for them. They get exercise and have fun.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product, not at all what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product, not at all what I expected, cheaply made, over priced. it is easy to put together though. Do not recommend this product.

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for active seniors
customer_reviews.text: Great for active seniors! Low to the ground and easy to pedal. Purchased as a Mother’s Day gift for someone who does a lot of indoor recumbent biking. She loved it. customer_reviews.author: Steph R.

customer_reviews.title: This bike is a great choice for a single speed not too expensive cruiser ...
customer_reviews.text: I live in Indiana and went to California for my Daughter's surgery. This bike is a great choice for a single speed not too expensive cruiser for those who can only ride trikes. 5 starts.

customer_reviews.text: As expected, very nice, easy to put together, and a marvelous form of ex erersise.

customer_reviews.title: The best investment I have ever made
customer_reviews.text: The seller was great and I got the bike right away. Being disabled for the past 13 years, I have found something that I can do that does not cause me any more pain. I would rate this bike a 100%. It is so easy to ride and it is the funniest thing since being injured. I bought it used and it only had a couple dents in one of the wheel covers. And like I said, the seller was great and I received it right on time.

customer_reviews.text: I find it odd but it's very hard to find these types of bikes thus my biggest complaint is short on value for the money. Should cost about 150 max. If you really want a recumbent bike pay more and get one with gears. You can't pedal this fast enough to keep up with friends on regular bikes.

customer_reviews.title: back ache
customer_reviews.text: The whole reason my son wanted a recumbant bike was because his regular bike 'hurt his back.' He rode this bike for a few days and then quit. When I asked him why he didn't ride more, he said it hurt his back. I have actually ridden this bike as well and it is a bit uncomfortable. I wish I would have gone with the more expensive version that had the rolls for the back instead of this hard 'cushion.' The only other problem is that it is hard to steer and impossible to back up. You have to literally pick it up and move it to turn it around in a small space.

customer_reviews.text: It’s a little smaller than I expected Sits really low to the ground I bought the adult bike looks like a child’s bike wish I would have just went into a bike shop and bought one I would not recommend this bike it’s great for a child but for an adult I would say that it sits to low the frame can be extended but it’s still really low to the ground
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sabanal

customer_reviews.title: Good for Exercise Only!
customer_reviews.text: Good Bike for Exercise! I'm 67 and have herniated cervical discs. I can't ride an ordinary bike as my neck hurts in that position. I walk each day, but needed a more vigorous workout. For the money this trike works. Good cardiovascular. You're outdoors, not sitting on a stationary bike indoors. Do not buy if you want to go fast or cruise long distance. For the naysayers who say it won't climb a grade, it's not true. My driveway is at a 40 degree angle and I have no problem. Again , as an exercise bike for daily short term use, it performs well. Does, however, encourage me to invest in a more expensive trike in future.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: needs improvment!!
customer_reviews.text: I have not had this trike long. Things that could be improved on would be for better performance it needs another speed. Only having the one speed creates such a slow paced route. Also the rear tires wear down way to fast. Its evident that the rubber quality in the tires is poor.

It does not have gears- but the geared versions are much more expensive. Well worth the money. I might get my own.

customer_reviews.title: No hills for this bike
customer_reviews.text: This is an ok bike and is only useful on level areas. If you will notice that there is no gearing and the person's weight is on the non-drive wheels, you cannot go up gentle slopes. You lose traction too easily on slopes. However, since there are not many moving parts, durability is the big plus. Additionally, you don't find too many recumbent bikes in this price range. It is fun but very limited in capabilities.

product_meta.title: Mobo Triton Pro Adult Tricycle for Men & Women. Beach Cruiser Trike. Pedal 3-Wheel Bike
product_meta.description:
A recumbent beach cruiser tricycle designed for those of us who want a little exercise and fun outside. This recumbent three-wheel bicycle is great for exercise, leisure rides, a quick trip to the market, or even walking the dog.

Trike recumbent bikes are more comfortable and let you ride and exercise longer. Ergonomic recumbent seat provides evenly cushioned back support. A three-wheeled cruiser for riders who cannot ride a standard upright bicycle. A tricycle recumbent is an excellent way to keep fit and enjoy the outdoors. Increase your daily calorie burn and get a cardiovascular workout with minimal stress on your knees, back and joints.

Features adjustable frame that makes riding this 3-wheel bicycle comfortable and easy for the whole family. Suitable for riders 4 feet 2 inches tall to 6 feet 3 inches tall and weighing up to 250 lbs. Almost anyone can ride this adult pedal trike!

Ride with confidence! Low center of gravity on this three-wheel cruiser provides unprecedented stability. No balance required. Dual-joystick steering offers smooth maneuverability with simple hand movements.

Durable heavy duty recumbent three-wheeled bicycle frame is constructed of Hi-ten steel. This tricycle cruiser features chainless design, caliper handbrakes, 20 inch front wheel with free-wheel hub, 16 inch rear wheels, inflatable rubber tires and a safety flag. Dimensions: 28 x 29 x 48 inches (61 inches extended). Weight 44 lbs. A 3-wheel bike for women, men, teens and kids ages 10 and up. Some assembly required.

While designed for adults of all abilities, also functions as a 3-wheel special needs bike for autistic and special needs adults who have problems with balance. Makes a great autistic toy for men and women. An especially effective special needs tricycle for adults with autism, aspergers syndrome, cerebral palsy, down syndrome, or mental challenges
feature_bullets: 3-Wheel Recumbent Bike – Enjoy the outdoors with this adult tricycle for women and men. Designed for cruising and exercise on flat paved surfaces and gently sloping terrain

Low Impact Exercise – Get a cardiovascular workout with minimal stress on your back and knees. Reclined seat provides evenly cushioned support. An outdoor tricycle for seniors and all adults who prefer a more stable, comfortable ride
No Balance Required – Low centre of gravity provides maximum stability. Dual-joystick steering offers smooth manoeuvrability with simple hand movements
Large & Small Riders – Easily adjusts to fit adult and youth riders from 4’2” to 6’3” and weighing up to 250 lbs.
Durable Design – Hi-Ten steel frame. No-maintenance chainless design. Free-wheel single gear hub with calliper brakes and safety flag.
Overal Dimensions – 28"W x 29"H x 48"L (61” extended); Wheels: 20” front, 16” rear; Weight 44 lbs.
